message: I'm soon launching a social networking site for college students and alumni, and I'm looking for Twitter Followers.  I've been running contests, and it's been working.  Open to any ideas that have worked for you.  You can follow us here: http://twitter.com/freezecrowd
I'm giving away an iPad 2 as well at 7,000 followers.
followed !
How are you publicizing your contest?
followed!
looks like you hit 7k
Follow me @stogaman

@stogaman followed you on Twitter (hesika on Twitter) and also asked on facebook for contact. By the way, you will get more contacts on facebook, when you "open" your profile. When people can see from outside, who are you, what interests do you have, what you are talking about (your wall), what fotos do you have? Why one should connect with you, if you don't give to know the other anything about you?

hey Eric, we've talked about this before but it comes down to content, you have 13,000+ people following you but no content.
Freezecrowd has been an idea of yours for a long time, stop procrastinating and launch already.
when we were building out our site we launched a precursor site 9http://www.LiveBaseballChat.com) that had some but not all the functionality and then built it up over time (still only V0.7)
@ericleebow no content no follow sorry
I have content so follow me http://twitter.com/craigshipp
done.
twitter.com/atollking

Brings up an interesting topic. I don't personally want more followers on Facebook (only people I know IRL) where Twitter I want followers so I get more reach. I'm curious who has a similar approach (or opposite).

@paff there is an old sayin: "Contacts harm only those, who haven't any...." My opinion: You never know, in which way a contact will become important to you. That counts both, on- and offline. Getting in touch only with people, who you already know, never will bring you to new horizons... Happy Easter to you!
following you, @atollking . Could you tell a little bit about VK? It looks like facebook. Could I get an invitation, please, to try it out? Or does it work only via iphone or similar?
@solveighcalderin In my experience, Facebook people friend me because they met me. Twitter people follow me because we share content interests. There's not a lot of cross-over.

agree 100% that you need more content - the feed is filled up with contests, which are great to have, but you need a balance of other content types. All these contents don't add value to your brand from my perspective. Good luck - the concept sounds really cool!

@paff My experience is another one. On facebook I found already several customers. Not only through my company page, but as well through my personal profile, because I'm able to contact with people from anywhere. Every contact could become a customer. On facebook I have the possibility to show myself in both directions: as an human being to talk with and with my business. People buy rather from people than from companies... Twitter is not only to share interests, but to share your own content through the web with your contacts elsewhere in the web in real time. I connected my twitter stream with I don't know how many other sites, like LinkedIn, Facebook, my website, blogs, to name a few. In both, facebook and twitter is much more in than you can imagine at this moment.
followers are always good to me ;) @freeosin
Any followers are welcome. I often post about my life, video games, science, music and more. :) http://twitter.com/#!/TheKoopaBros
